title: No. 2 Baylor overwhelms West Virginia 62-38
text:
No. 2 Baylor overwhelms West Virginia 62-38 Corey Coleman caught three more touchdowns and second-ranked Baylor won its FBS-best 19th consecutive home game Post to Facebook No. 2 Baylor overwhelms West Virginia 62-38 Corey Coleman caught three more touchdowns and second-ranked Baylor won its FBS-best 19th consecutive home game   WFAA.com: http://on.wfaa.com/1LAyhOZ   Join the Conversation To   No. 2 Baylor overwhelms West Virginia 62-38 Stephen Hawkins, Associated Press 3:09 p.m. CDT October 17, 2015 Baylor Bears wide receiver Corey Coleman (1) catches a pass as West Virginia Mountaineers cornerback Daryl Worley (7) defends during the first quarter at McLane Stadium on October 17, 2015. (Photo: Jerome Miron / USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
WACO (AP) â€” Corey Coleman caught three more touchdowns and second-ranked Baylor won its FBS-best 19th consecutive home game, getting some measure of revenge with a 62-38 victory over West Virginia on Saturday. 
Coleman matched and then broke the single-season school record for TD catches, his nation-leading 16 coming halfway through the regular season for the Bears (6-0, 3-0 Big 12). 
Seth Russell became the only Baylor quarterback other than Heisman Trophy winner Robert Griffin III in 2011 to throw for 300 yards and run for 100 yards in the same game. Russell had five TD passes and ran 14 times for 160 yards with another score. BOX SCORE: Baylor vs. West Virginia 
Baylor's only regular-season loss last year was 41-27 at West Virginia, and the Bears wound up the first team left out of the initial College Football Playoff. 
Skyler Howard, from Fort Worth, Texas, less than 100 miles from the Baylor campus, threw four TD passes for West Virginia (3-3, 0-3).
